Package utils

Class UIFormatter

java.lang.Object
utils.UIFormatter
public class UIFormatter extends Object
Provides consistent UI formatting for the BTO Management System command-line interface. This utility class centralizes all text formatting, color management, and display standardization to ensure a consistent user experience throughout the application. Features include: - Semantic color coding for different message types (success, error, warning, etc.) - Automatic detection of terminal color support - Status-based color highlighting for application states - Consistent header and divider formatting - Support for enabling/disabling colors globally Follows the Open/Closed Principle by providing extension points for new formatting without modifying existing code.

  • Method Details

    • setColorEnabled

      public static void setColorEnabled(boolean enable)
      Enables or disables color output globally. Useful for environments where ANSI colors are not supported.
      Parameters:
      enable - true to enable colors, false to disable

      Returns:

      Returns:

    • formatRegistrationStatus

      public static String formatRegistrationStatus(String registrationStatus)

      Returns:
      Color-coded registration status text

      Returns:

    • supportsColors

      public static boolean supportsColors()
      Determines if the current terminal environment supports ANSI colors. Checks various environment variables and platform-specific features.
      Returns:
      true if colors are supported by the terminal
